Site.name: I.D. Guide
Site.workInProgress: We're working to add more provinces and territories. Check back soon for expanded support across Canada.

HomePage.headline: You deserve identity documents that reflect your life
HomePage.headlineSmall: and don't make it more difficult
HomePage.intro1-1: Navigating name and gender marker changes can feel overwhelming, but
HomePage.intro1-3: to support you every step of the way.
HomePage.idCardUpdates: Driver's license or I.D. card updates

StartPage.intro: To get started, use the checkboxes below to customize an action plan. The steps will update automatically based on your selections.

action.changeLegalNameOntario: Change your legal name with the Ontario Office of the Registrar General
action.changeLegalNameAlberta: Change your legal name with the Alberta Vital Statistics Agency
action.changeLegalNameManitoba: Change your legal name with the Manitoba Vital Statistics Agency
action.updateGenderBirthCertificate: Update the gender marker on your birth certificate
action.updateNameHealthCard: Update the name on your health card
action.updateNameOntarioHealthCard: Update the name on your Ontario health card
action.updateNameGenderOntarioID: Update the name and gender marker on your Ontario driver's license or I.D. card
action.updateNameGenderID: Update the name and gender marker on your driver's license or I.D. card
action.updateNameGenderPassport: Update the name and gender marker on your Canadian passport
action.updateNameGenderPR: Update the name and gender marker on your permanent residency card
action.updateNameGenderSIN: Update your name and gender marker with the Social Insurance registry
action.updateNameGenderCRA: Update your name and gender marker with the Canada Revenue Agency

StartPage.selectCheckboxes: Please select one or both checkboxes above to see your action plan.
StartPage.guidesHelp: Each guide above provides step-by-step instructions, required forms, and tips to help make the process as smooth as possible.

GuidesPage.idCardUpdates: Driver's license and I.D. card updates

ResourcesPage.intro: This table lists organizations offering trans I.D. clinics, legal support, healthcare, peer groups, and other resources for 2SLGBTQ+ people across Canada. You'll also find links below to our lists of region-specific resources.

DownloadsPage.intro: Here you'll find the forms to help with name changes and gender marker updates, as well as presentation materials for past workshops. If you need help finding the right document, please check the sources at the bottom of the related guide, or

AboutPage.about-1: is a free, community-driven resource designed to help people navigate legal name, gender marker, and identity document changes in Canada. We aim to make this process less stressful and more accessible—especially for trans, non-binary, Two-Spirit, and gender non-conforming communities.
AboutPage.about-2: Everyone deserves clear, accurate, and up-to-date information—but government agencies often make these processes confusing or hard to access. I.D. Guide brings together practical, step-by-step instructions and forms in one place to help you navigate these changes confidently. While we do not provide legal advice, our goal is to empower you to make informed choices and advocate for yourself.
AboutPage.about-4: a designer and web/software developer based in Toronto. Since 2021, Dana has delivered workshops on name and gender marker changes for organizations across Ontario. To learn more or book a presentation, visit our
AboutPage.about-5: If you would like to help support Dana and her work, you can send her a tip

NameChanges.process: The process for changing your legal name will vary depending on your province or territory of residency
NameChanges.manitobaApplicationName: Manitoba application for an adult legal change of name
NameChanges.ontarioApplicationName: Ontario application to change an adult's name

birthCertificates.process: The process for updating your birth certificate will vary depending on the province or territory in which you were born

HealthCards.process: The process for updating your health card will vary depending on your province or territory of residency

IdCards.process: The process for updating your driver's license or I.D. card will vary depending on your province or territory of residency

Disclaimers.disclaimer-1: I.D. Guide is an independent project and is not affiliated with any government agency or official body. All information is provided in good faith, but users should always verify details with the relevant authorities.
Disclaimers.disclaimer-2: While we strive to keep all information up to date, laws and procedures can change. Please check official sources or contact the appropriate agency for the most current requirements. The content on this site is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice. For legal advice specific to your situation, consult a qualified legal professional.
Disclaimers.disclaimer-3: If you spot an error, have a suggestion, or need information in a different format, please
Disclaimers.disclaimer-4: Your feedback helps keep this resource accurate and useful for everyone.
